intro: Pilosella nemophila, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features small, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as meadows and forest edges. Pilosella nemophila is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
